alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:33PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carbon County and southern Albany County through 630 PM MDT... At 531 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking locally strong outflow winds associated with thunderstorms 11 miles northeast of North Fork Campground, or 22 miles northwest of Laramie, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Albany, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Six Mile Campground, Bosler, Tie Siding, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Pumpkin Vine, Vedauwoo Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, Boswell Creek Campground, The Buttes, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Bobbie Thompson Campground and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 255 and 334. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
